Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Desirable \De*sir"a*ble\, a. [F. d['e]sirable, fr. L. desiderabilis. See {Desire}, v. t.] Worthy of desire or longing; fitted to excite desire or a wish to possess; pleasing; agreeable. [1913 Webster]
All of them desirable young men. --Ezek. xxiii. 12. [1913 Webster]
As things desirable excite Desire, and objects move the appetite. --Blackmore. [1913 Webster]

desirable adj 1: worth having or seeking or achieving; "a desirable job"; "computer with many desirable features"; "a desirable outcome" [ant: {undesirable}] 2: worthy of being chosen especially as a spouse; "the parents found the girl suitable for their son" [syn: {suitable}, {worthy}]
